criteria.name: Clear Research Methodology
criteria.description: Is the research methodology explicitly stated?

criteria.name: Step-by-step description
criteria.description: Is there a step-by-step description of the study design?

criteria.name: Open Data 1
criteria.description: Are the raw or processed datasets publicly available or has it been mentioned where the data can be found?

criteria.name: Open Data 2
criteria.description: If data cannot be shared, is there a clear justification (e.g., privacy concerns)?

criteria.name: Data Documentation
criteria.description: Is there a data dictionary or codebook explaining variables, formats, and preprocessing steps?

criteria.name: Data Collection Methods
criteria.description: Are data collection methods fully described?

criteria.name: Open Source Code 1
criteria.description: Is the analysis code (Python, R, etc.) shared in an open repository (GitHub, GitLab) or somewhere else publicly available?

criteria.name: Open Source Code 2
criteria.description: If code cannot be shared, is there a clear justification?

criteria.name: Code for Data preparation
criteria.description: Is code for data preparation (e.g. pre-processing) shared or mentioned?

criteria.name: Quantitative Research Methods 1
criteria.description: Are statistical tests, models, and assumptions clearly described?

criteria.name: Quantitative Research Methods 2
criteria.description: Are effect sizes, confidence intervals, and p-values reported?

criteria.name: Qualitative Research Methods 1
criteria.description: Is subjective context and interpretation given?

criteria.name: Qualitative Research Methods 2
criteria.description: Is data coding and analysis clearly described and shared?

criteria.name: Clearly presented Results
criteria.description: Have the results been clearly documented?

criteria.name: Limitations and potential biases
criteria.description: Are limitations and potential biases discussed?

criteria.name: Preregistration
criteria.description: Does the Paper contain a link to the preregistration (e.g the Open Science Foundation)?
